    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Barbazu (Bearded Devil)</h1>Barbazus, known also as bearded devils or infantry devils, are murderous fiends who satiate their lust for annihilation by serving as the foot soldiers of Hell’s armies, often leading hordes of lesser devils such as imps and lemures into battle. Bearded devils wield serrated glaives to inflict jagged gashes that resist healing magic, resulting in tremendous blood loss. When enemies come too close, bearded devils strike with the spines of their wriggling beards to deliver a wretched contagion called Avernal fever, savoring the sight of their victim’s strength being slowly devoured from within.<br /><br /> Barbazus can be found savagely indulging the whims of evil infernal lords from all layers of Hell, rejoicing as they disseminate murder, misery, and anguish as they see fit.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Fiend</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 20<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=110">Barbazu</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 5</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Devil_Barbazu.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Devil_Barbazu.png"></a><span alt="Lawful Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Lawful Evil">LE</span><span alt="Medium" class="traitsize" title="Medium">Medium</span><span alt="Devil Trait" class="trait" title="A family of fiends from Hell, most devils are irredeemably lawful evil. They typically have greater darkvision, immunity to fire, and telepathy."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=44">Devil</a></span><span alt="Fiend Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the evil-aligned planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=70">Fiend</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 88</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +13; greater darkvision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=16"><u>Celestial</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=2"><u>Draconic</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=19"><u>Infernal</a></u>; telepathy 100 feet<br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +11, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +13, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +10, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13"><u>Religion</a></u> +11, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +11<br /><b>Str</b> +4, <b>Dex</b> +2, <b>Con</b> +4, <b>Int</b> -2, <b>Wis</b> +2, <b>Cha</b> +1<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=20"><u>glaive</u></a><hr /><b>AC</b> 22, <b>Fort</b> +15, <b>Ref</b> +11, <b>Will</b> +11; +1 status to all saves vs. magic<br /><b>HP</b> 60; <b>Immunities</b> fire; <b>Resistances</b> physical 5 (except silver), poison 10; <b>Weaknesses</b> good 5<br /><b>Attack of Opportunity</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"><hr /><b>Speed</b> 35 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> glaive +15 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=174"><u>deadly 1d8</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=64"><u>evil</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=180"><u>forceful</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d8+7 slashing plus 2d6 evil and infernal wound</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> claw +15 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=64"><u>evil</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d6+7 slashing plus 1d6 evil</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> beard +15 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6+7 piercing plus Avernal fever</span><b>Divine Innate Spells</b> DC 19; <b>5th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=69">dimension door</a></u></i>; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=69">dimension door</a></u></i> (at will)<br /><b>Rituals</b> DC 19; <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Rituals.aspx?ID=23">infernal pact</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Avernal Fever</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46"><u>disease</a></u>) <b>Saving Throw</b> DC 23 Fortitude; <b>Stage 1</b> carrier with no ill effect (1 day); <b>Stage 2</b> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=13">enfeebled 1</a> (1 day); <b>Stage 3</b> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=13">enfeebled 2</a> (1 day)</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Infernal Wound</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117"><u>necromancy</a></u>) A bearded devil’s glaive Strike also deals 1d6 persistent bleed damage that resists attempts to heal it. The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at DC 20. The DC is reduced to 15 only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery.<br /> The DC to Administer First Aid to a creature with an infernal wound is increased by 5. A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering from an infernal wound must succeed at a DC 21 counteract check or the magic fails to heal the creature.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Reposition</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Free Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\FreeAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Free Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\FreeAction_I.png">  <b>Trigger</b> The devil hits a creature with a glaive Strike. <b>Effect</b> The devil moves the creature 5 feet in any direction. The destination square must be within reach of the devil’s glaive. This movement doesn’t trigger reactions.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Wriggling Beard</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  <b>Frequency</b> once per round. <b>Effect</b> The barbazu makes a beard Strike. This Strike ignores their multiple attack penalty and doesn’t count toward that penalty.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=30">Devil</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=110">Barbazu (Bearded Devil)</a></td><td>5</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=482">Cornugon (Horned Devil)</a></td><td>16</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=111">Erinys (Fury Devil)</a></td><td>8</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=113">Gelugon (Ice Devil)</a></td><td>13</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=109">Imp</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=108">Lemure</a></td><td>0</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=456">Osyluth (Bone Devil)</a></td><td>9</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=112">Phistophilus (Contract Devil)</a></td><td>10</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=114">Pit Fiend (Tyrant Devil)</a></td><td>20</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=30">Devil</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 86</i></a><br />Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks. Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly lemures and imps perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as contract devils and erinyes, while the greatest pit fiends command entire infernal armies.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Archdevils</h3>At any one time, eight archdevils rule the eight upper layers of Hell, while the deepest layer is ruled by Asmodeus. Each archdevil is a unique demigod with a dedicated role in guiding the infernal machine forward. Barbatos is the doorwarden of Hellʼs uppermost layer, while Dispater rules Hellʼs largest city. Mammon guards Hellʼs treasuries, and Belial designs new weapons for Hellʼs legions. Geryon is the oldest archdevil and keeper of many secrets, while Moloch leads Hellʼs armies. Baalzebul is a brooding archdevil who has fallen from Asmodeusʼs favor, while mighty Mephistopheles was formed from the plane of Hell itself.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Diabolic Divinities</h3>Many unique and powerful devils hold positions of power in Hell. The most numerous of these are the infernal dukes, many of whom were promoted to this position from already impressive statures as pit fiends. The supreme ruler of Hell itself is Asmodeus, the Prince of Darkness. Between these two tiers rule the eight archdevils—see the sidebar on the facing page.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Locations" title="Sidebar - Locations" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_3_Locations.png"> Diabolic Locations</h3>The nine layers of Hell are the planar home of all devils, and they much prefer its tyrannically ordered environs to anywhere else in the multiverse. Yet devils can be encountered anywhere mortals can be tempted by infernal bargains or seek diabolic aid. On Golarion, the nation of Cheliax is particularly aligned with Hell. Its government is based upon Hellʼs organization, and the state church is that of Asmodeus.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Fiendish Relations</h3>Devils view daemonsʼ constant hunt for souls as a short-sighted waste of potential, and demonsʼ chaotic destruction of society and flesh as uncivilized and obnoxious, but they do not loathe their fiendish counterparts. Indeed, most devils are more than willing to take advantage of daemons and demons as they can to further their own machinations.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Devils</h3>The devils presented on these pages are a small sampling of the torments Hell has to offer. Other devils, like the inquisition-focused bone devils, the cherub-faced and fly-bodied accuser devils, and the aquatic drowning devil are a few examples of these widespread immortal creatures.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
